They've gone full mask-off: 𝐝𝐨 𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐫 trust @OpenAI or its products (ChatGPT etc). There is only one reason for appointing an @NSAGov Director to your board. This is a willful, calculated betrayal of the rights of every person on Earth. You have been warned.

Not only how to define what to measure but also how to “implement“ the measurement matters. This makes me wonder if it is safe to compare stats, like unemployment rate, of different countries with different implementations of measurements.

But unlike Sora or KLING, it's completely open access to the public.

Are these graphs the same? Turns out there is a graph isomorphism between them - the relationships between vertices and edges is identical.

To be fair, Mastodon and Bluesky don't make their equivalents of Likes public either, and Facebook doesn't publicly list Likes on profiles.
The question of visibility/privacy of Likes and other interactions will be interesting from a platform interoperability perspective, though.
